result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:03 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur.  District Attorney Karl E Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicolae Miu appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Attorney Corey Chirafisi appeared by video for Nicolae Miu. Court reviews file. Atty Nelson has a copy of Information and states Defendant is aware of charges and maximum penalties. Atty Nelson enters NG pleas to all charges. Defendant waives right to personal appearance for today's hearing. DA Anderson requests a status in 30-45 days to allow time for discovery to be given to defense. Atty Nelson agrees. Court sets STC and Court approves Atty Chirafisi to appear by Zoom. Speedy trial not asserted at this time. Adjourned at 1:08 PM.  gll

9:15 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. District Attorney Karl E Anderson and Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Aaron A. Nelson in court for Nicolae Miu.  Attorney Corey Chirafisi in court for Nicolae Miu. Defendant Nicolae Miu in court, in custody. DA Anderson calls Lt. Brandie Hart of SCSO to testify. S/T Lt. Hart. Direct by DA Anderson. Lt. identifies Defendant. Cross by Atty Chirafisi. Redirect by DA Anderson. Witness excused. Closing arguments. Court reviews testimony. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court sets Arraignment. Adjourned at 9:53 AM.  gll
Arraignment scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

of Motion. Filed by Atty Chirafisi. km

- Defendant to surrender passport upon release to the St. Croix Count Clerk of Court.

- No use or possession of a dangerous weapon as defined in Wis. Stat. 939.22(10). "Dangerous weapon" means any firearm, whether loaded or unloaded; any device designed as a weapon and capable of producing death or great bodily harm; any electric weapon, as defined in s. 941.295 (4); or any other device or instrumentality which, in the manner it is used or intended to be used, is calculated or likely to produce death or great bodily harm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Victims  2, 3, 4, or 5, or Victim 1's family members. See Identification Key.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least FOUR times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- I further understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device and may not be within .5 miles of any of the victim's residences. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

10:01 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicolae Miu appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared by video for Nicolae Miu.  Attorney Corey Chirafisi appeared by video for Nicolae Miu. Court reviews file. Court questions Defendant. Court finds Defendant freely and voluntarily waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court resets Preliminary Hearing. DA Anderson requests bond be modified to include Defendant to surrender passport. Atty Chirafisi states no objection. Court modifies bond.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:09 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. DA: Karl Anderson with Erica Ellenwood  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah Harrelson for today Defendant Nicolae Miu appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE doesn't qualify for PD. Court advises Defendant of charges and possible penalties. Defendant understands. Waive reading.  Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court states bond will include language defining dangerous weapons. Court sets PH and STC to check status of atty. DE given PFAC. Adjourned at 1:30 pm.  gll
